relations.head: Stat-3
relations.label: upregulate
relations.text: Deletion of Stat-3 leads to decreased surfactant proteins in the lung.

relations.head: Surfactant protein B
relations.label: inhibit
relations.text: Exogenous surfactant protein B ameliorates lung injury.

relations.head: Stat-3
relations.label: inhibit
relations.text: Stat-3 deletion exacerbates lung injury under hyperoxia.

analysis:
Context:  
Based on the abstract, the study investigates how Stat-3 in respiratory epithelial cells mediates resistance to hyperoxia‐induced lung injury. Hyperoxia is a pathogenic environmental stress condition (prolonged exposure to >95% oxygen) causing acute lung injury. Therefore, the context is “hyperoxia,” and the context type is “Pathological/Environmental Stress.”

Nodes (with types):  
• Stat-3 → protein  
• Surfactant protein B → protein  
• Acute lung injury → disease  

Regulatory Relationships (directly inferred from the abstract):  
1. Stat-3 upregulates Surfactant protein B.  (Deletion of Stat-3 leads to decreased surfactant proteins in the lung.)  
2. Surfactant protein B inhibits Acute lung injury.  (Exogenous surfactant protein B ameliorates lung injury.)  
3. Stat-3 inhibits Acute lung injury.  (Stat-3 deletion exacerbates lung injury under hyperoxia.)
